metadata.title: Agent Dashboard POV - Trouble Ticket Resolution
metadata.description: Shows the support agent's experience viewing auto-created trouble tickets with AI classification context on the Agent Dashboard.

steps.narration: Finally, let's see the support agent's perspective. The Agent Dashboard shows all trouble tickets created by the AI platform. This is where human agents monitor and resolve customer issues.

The dashboard summary shows key metrics at a glance: total tickets, open tickets, resolved tickets, and SLA breaches. Currently we see 1 total ticket, zero open, 1 resolved, and zero SLA breaches. The AI-powered workflow has already handled the resolution.

Below the summary stats, we can see the ticket list. The ticket titled Internet outage building B was automatically created by the Telegram-to-CRM workflow when the customer reported their network issue.

steps.selector: a:has-text('Internet outage building B'), tr:has-text('Internet outage building B'), [href*='1baae3e7-615d-4b25-872f-eb9c3712d287']
steps.narration: Let's open the ticket to see the full details.

The ticket detail page shows all the TMF621-compliant fields. The AI platform automatically populated the ticket with the customer's complaint details, classified the issue category as a network problem, and assigned the appropriate priority level.

Scrolling down, we can see additional fields including the AI-generated classification context, sentiment analysis results, and the original customer message. The TMF621 standard ensures these tickets are interoperable with any telecom operations system.

The ticket also includes resolution notes, timestamps, and the complete audit trail. The support agent can see exactly how the AI processed this request — from the initial Telegram message through intent classification to ticket creation — all without manual intervention.

This completes the three-perspective view of the BM AI Platform. The customer sent a simple Telegram message, the platform orchestrated a multi-step AI workflow, and the support agent received a fully contextualized, TMF621-compliant trouble ticket — all automated, all auditable, all in seconds.
